intro: I'm a Senior Software Engineer focused on architecture, complex UI systems, and long-term maintainability. I've owned complete frontend implementations on multi-person teams and served as the sole frontend developer on large production projects. My work tends to live where product complexity and technical rigor meet.

principles.title: Accessibility is a baseline
principles.description: Not an enhancement or a nice-to-have. I've implemented extensive ARIA support and full keyboard navigation in production systems because it's foundational to quality software.

principles.title: Predictable over clever
principles.description: I optimize for correctness and stability first. Explicit state, clear data flow, minimal magic. Code should be easy to understand and maintain six months later.

principles.title: Thinking in constraints
principles.description: I start by identifying failure modes and second-order effects. Understanding what can go wrong leads to more durable solutions than assuming everything will work.

principles.title: Clarity over persuasion
principles.description: My teaching background shows up in how I write, explain, and document systems. I care more about being understood than sounding impressive.

principles.title: Tradeoffs, not best practices
principles.description: Every decision has costs. I prefer discussing real tradeoffs rather than defaulting to dogma. Context matters more than convention.
